t: Psalm 51
A Contrite Sinnerâ€™s Prayer for Pardon.
For the choir director. A Psalm of David, when Nathan the prophet came to him, after he had gone in to Bathsheba.
Be*pn gracious to me, O God, according to Your lovingkindness; According*ln to the greatness of Your compassion blot out my transgressions.
Wash*ln me thoroughly from my iniquity And*ln cleanse me from my sin.
For*ln I know my transgressions, And*ln my sin is ever before me.
Against*ln You, You only, I have sinned And*ln done what is evil in Your sight, So*ln that You are justified when You speak And*ln blameless when You judge.
Behold,*ln I was brought forth in iniquity, And*ln in sin my mother conceived me.
Behold,*ln You desire truth in the innermost being, And*ln in the hidden part You will make me know wisdom.
Purify*ln me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; Wash*ln me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
Make*ln me to hear joy and gladness, Let*ln the bones which You have broken rejoice.
Hide*ln Your face from my sins And*ln blot out all my iniquities.
Create*ln in me a clean heart, O God, And*ln renew a steadfast spirit within me.
Do*ln not cast me away from Your presence And*ln do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.
Restore*ln to me the joy of Your salvation And*ln sustain me with a willing spirit.
Then*iln I will teach transgressors Your ways, And*ln sinners will be converted to You.
Deliver*ln me from bloodguiltiness, O God, the God of my salvation; Then*iln my tongue will joyfully sing of Your righteousness.
O*ln Lord, open my lips, That*ln my mouth may declare Your praise.
For*ln You do not delight in sacrifice, otherwise I would give it; You*ln are not pleased with burnt offering.
The*ln sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; A*ln broken and a contrite heart, O God, You will not despise.
By*ln Your favor do good to Zion; Build*ln the walls of Jerusalem.
Then*ln You will delight in righteous sacrifices, In*ln burnt offering and whole burnt offering; Then*ln young bulls will be offered on Your altar.
